description: Describes a root volume replacement task. For more information, see Replace a root volume in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

parameters.name: ReplaceRootVolumeTaskIds
parameters.description: The ID of the root volume replacement task to view. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Filter to use: instance-id - The ID of the instance for which the root volume replacement task was created. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: ReplaceRootVolumeTasks
nested_items.description: Information about the root volume replacement task.

nested_items.name: ReplaceRootVolumeTaskId
nested_items.description: The ID of the root volume replacement task.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the instance for which the root volume replacement task was created.

nested_items.name: TaskState
nested_items.description: The state of the task. The task can be in one of the following states:
pending - the replacement volume is being created.
in-progress - the original volume is being detached and the replacement volume is being attached.
succeeded - the replacement volume has been successfully attached to the instance and the instance is available.
failing - the replacement task is in the process of failing.
failed - the replacement task has failed but the original root volume is still attached.
failing-detached - the replacement task is in the process of failing. The instance might have no root volume attached.
failed-detached - the replacement task has failed and the instance has no root volume attached.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time the task was started.

nested_items.name: CompleteTime
nested_items.description: The time the task completed.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags assigned to the task.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI used to create the replacement root volume.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The ID of the snapshot used to create the replacement root volume.

nested_items.name: DeleteReplacedRootVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the original root volume is to be deleted after the root volume replacement task completes.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
